Ad astra per aspera 

Join us this #MemorialDay in remembering and honoring all those who made the ultimate sacrifice in service to our country.

LIVE: We're announcing the Phase 2 winners for our 
@NASAPrize
 Deep Space Food Challenge, a global competition to develop sustainable ways of producing healthy food for long-term missions to the Moon, Mars, and beyond.

Watch with us at #NYCxDESIGN:

NASA and 
@RocketLab
 are targeting 9pm ET Sunday, May 7 (0100 May 8 UTC), for the first launch of our cyclone-studying TROPICS CubeSats.

Tune in here and at http://nasa.gov/live at 8:40pm ET (0040 May 8 UTC) for live launch coverage from New Zealand: https://go.nasa.gov/42xYE3n

A new habitat is prepped for volunteers to test living in Mars-like conditions for a year, 
@NASAWebb
 detects signs of water vapor on a distant planet, and we celebrate #BlackHoleWeek—that’s what’s up This Week at NASA. 

Wrap up the celebration with us: https://go.nasa.gov/44B3u1j

We can’t imagine a more beautiful thing than May’s full moon – the Corn Moon. 

Set to peak on May 5 at 1:34pm ET (1634 UTC ), this full moon, also known as the Flower Moon, will appear full till Sunday. Discover how it got its names: http://go.nasa.gov/3piIAUs
Four of Uranus’ largest moons—Ariel, Umbriel, Titania, and Oberon—may have oceans beneath their icy crusts, according to a re-analysis of Voyager 2 data. https://go.nasa.gov/3VQtF0l

Earth is our home. 

On #EarthDay and every day, we’re learning more about our world and how it’s changing – giving us a deeper appreciation for the planet we call home.

Celebrate with us: https://go.nasa.gov/3mZmeXx

This #WorldQuantumDay, discover what the quantum realm is really like and how NASA studies it every day—with Ant-Man actor Paul Rudd!

Find out how our exploration of quantum science could help unlock the universe’s biggest mysteries. https://go.nasa.gov/3U0RjG9

Ingenuity perseveres.

Our #MarsHelicopter just flew its 50th flight on the Red Planet (out of a planned five), nearly two years after it first took to the Martian skies. This demo is giving a glimpse of the future of powered flight on other worlds. https://mars.nasa.gov/ingenuity

We love Lucy!

The 
@NASASolarSystem
 #LucyMission captured its first views of four of its Trojan asteroid targets, from 330 million miles (530 million kilometers) away. Set to fly by in 2027-2028, Lucy will be the first mission ever to visit them:
https://go.nasa.gov/43tu8c3
We’re bringing back a bit of Bennu. Have questions about our asteroid sample return mission? Submit your question below and hear from experts starting at 2 pm ET.

We celebrate International #HumanSpaceFlight Day honoring the accomplishments of the first person in space in 1961, and the first launch of the space shuttle in 1981. 

Next, with 
@NASAArtemis
, we continue humanity’s progress with Moon & Mars exploration!

Tail installed 

Soon, 
@NASAAero
’s X-59 will take to the skies to demonstrate a new quiet form of supersonic flight. This technology could bring a return to supersonic flight over land—cutting flight times in half. More on the Quesst mission: https://nasa.gov/specials/Quesst/…

What's new on the Web(b)?

We always have the latest hi-res images from 
@NASAWebb
 available to view (and download) at http://webbtelescope.org. Stop by and make sure you haven't missed any!

Designed to endure at least 7 passes through Jupiter's intense radiation, the JunoCam instrument has survived 50 so far – and it’s still going strong. In this new @googlearts exhibition, celebrate the otherworldly vistas “the public’s camera” has shown us: https://artsandculture.google.com/story/XwUxhKx1GDOOTA…
